references.paper_title: Unraveling the key components of OOD generalization via diversification
references.reason: This paper is highly relevant as it directly addresses the core topic of out-of-distribution generalization, a central theme of the subject paper.
This foundational paper introduces bagging, a crucial ensemble method that underpins many ensemble diversification techniques discussed in the subject paper.
This seminal work details random forests, another key ensemble method frequently compared with and used as a baseline in the subject paper's experimental evaluations.

references.paper_title: Dropout as a Bayesian approximation: Representing model uncertainty in deep learning
references.reason: This paper establishes the theoretical link between dropout and Bayesian methods, which is relevant to the Bayesian principles used for OOD detection in the subject paper.

references.paper_title: Simple and scalable predictive uncertainty estimation using deep ensembles
references.reason: This paper introduces a practical approach to predictive uncertainty estimation using deep ensembles, a core concept applied and extended in the subject paper's OOD detection methodology.
